I already have recommended this! i love horror but most games are just filled with jump scares but this one has an actual "wait, what the hell was that?" And when i, playing against the spirit i always have to find myself playing mind games with the opponent. This game has a great community and it is both competitive and fun. There are so many ways to play this game from generator rushing to messing with the hunter to saving team members and with killers you can play it slow and methodical or fast paced rush in and kill them. Glhf!
Es un juegaso!

The sense of tension that you have when you are a survivor trying to fix the generators. The heart beat and the sounds fix perfectly with the fact that after you have some time in the game you will never know who it is you're fighting against. So you can never adjust your game play until you either see them or hear them. I would recommend this game to anyone who wants a sense of adrenaline or enjoys the feeling of being hunted down.

There is probably not other experience like this game out there, it can be really fun and very thrilling in some cases. As a survivor mechanics are simple, you are send to a map and you have to repair some generators which will allow you to open a gate to be able to escape. You can find some items or start with them at the beginning of the match which will give you a slight advantage on the right circumstances. Every survivor comes with their own set of skills in which you level high enough other survivors can learn as well. Some of the skills are very hepfull in the game while others are pretty much pointless. The adrenaline of knowing that you will be find by the killer or knowing there is only one more generator to be able to open the gates, can be very addictive.

I have not play enugh as a killer to give a solid opinion on it, but from what i play is almost as thrilling or even more than been a survivor. 

The game can be highly enjoyable, but unfortunately game is  very unbalanced, owed to the assymetric nature of it. Since playing survivor and killer are totally different experiences, matchmaking is probably very hard to make it right. This is not a competitive kind of game, were both sides can have the same level of skills and abilities and it will be fair game. This games is either the survivors are escape artists or you will face a godlike killer. Either situation can make it very frustrating for the player, since the ways to escape are limited, and sometimes you may be facing experience killers in consecutive matches. In the case of the killer, I think they have more variation to their skills and how to approach and kill a survivor, which i believe may be more enjoyable.

Other aspect that is highly unbalanced are the maps. Some of the maps survivors have more room to escape while others clearly the killer has and advantage. This also can be very frustrating if you face the same maps over and over again.

Overall the game is enjoyable and can give you lots of thrills and even some laughs some times.

Fun game with friends; frustrating as hell without. The game gets kudos for being different from mainstream video game genres. However, the balance of certain perks is completely off in favor of the killer, especially No One Escapes Death. It is beyond broken and only serves to give bad players cheap wins without any skill or effort required. it's enough to ruin the game and remove your incentive to play at higher ranks, especially when you encounter it every game. The developers need to find middle-ground with perks instead of making them completely one-sided to the point where the other side doesn't have a chance. 

TLDR: Fun at lower ranks until you match people abusing busted killer perks. Then the fun disappears completely due to awful game balance at the meta level and no action from the devs to correct it.

This game is equal parts fun and frustrating. Solo queue is what it is, you'll have hit or miss games with randoms deciding to circle jerk in a corner or somehow be the most fluid team with almost no ability to communicate. This is one of those games where you start to play and you think you're getting good and you discover that there is a whole other side to it as far as strategy and perk synthesizing to maximize your survivability in different ways. No matter how frustrated I get, I always come back but I genuinely enjoy the rifts (seasons) with misc cosmetic rewards but also the regular release of new content and annual events is pretty great too.

I love that the DLCs are absolutely not necessary starting out and something you can acquire over time or not at all if you don't feel like it and it doesn't affect the ability to play with friends.
